text: {{Infobox settlement | official_name = Pays de la Loire | native_name = | native_name_lang = fr | settlement_type = Region of France | image_skyline = Chateau Montsoreau Loire.jpg | image_caption = Château de Montsoreau | image_flag = Cultural flag of Pays-de-la-Loire.svg | flag_size = 120px | image_shield = Blason région fr Pays-de-la-Loire.svg | shield_size = | image_blank_emblem = Région Pays-de-la-Loire (logo).svg | blank_emblem_size = 200 | image_map = Pays de la Loire region locator map2.svg | map_caption = | motto = | coordinates = | subdivision_type = Country | subdivision_name = | seat_type = Prefecture | seat = Nantes | parts_type = Departments | parts_style = list | parts = 5 | p1 = Loire-Atlantique | p2 = Maine-et-Loire | p3 = Mayenne | p4 = Sarthe | p5 = Vendée | p6 = | p7 = | p8 = | p9 = | p10 = | p11 = | p12 = | p13 = | p14 = | leader_party = LR | leader_title = President of the Regional Council | leader_name = Christelle Morançais | area_footnotes = | area_total_km2 = 32082 | area_land_km2 = | area_water_km2 = | area_rank = 8th | population_footnotes = | population_total = 3553352 | population_as_of = | population_density_km2 = auto | population_demonym = | timezone1 = CET | utc_offset1 = +01:00 | timezone1_DST = CEST | utc_offset1_DST = +02:00 | blank_name_sec1 = GDP (2012) | blank_info_sec1 = Ranked 5th | blank1_name_sec1 = Total | blank1_info_sec1 = €101.2 billion (US$130.2 bn) | blank2_name_sec1 = Per capita | blank2_info_sec1 = €27,775 (US$35,725) | blank_name_sec2 = NUTS Region | blank_info_sec2 = FR5 | website = www.paysdelaloire.fr | iso_code = FR-PDL | footnotes = }} Pays de la Loire (or Pays-de-la-Loire) is an administrative region of France. Its capital is Nantes. In 2018, about 3.8 million people lived in the region. There are seven big centers, with more than 100.000 people in the respective urban area: Nantes, Angers, Le Mans, La Roche-sur-Yon, Cholet, Saint-Nazaire and Laval. The departments in the region are: *Loire-Atlantique *Maine-et-Loire *Mayenne *Sarthe *Vendée The economy is centered around the production of food, and agriculture in general. It is the third in France in that sector. 51% of meat products, 19% of milk, and 67% of the natural produce of grain (cereals) are produced there. == Languages == Some people in the region also speak other local languages. These are * Angevin * Breton * Gallo * Poitevin Breton is a Celtic language, the others are Romance languages. ==References== ==Other websites==
title: Pays de la Loire
